Drinks.description: Originally served in a copper mug with a kicking mule imprinted on it, perfectly illustrating the fieriness of this vodka and ginger beer mix.
Drinks.name: Moscow Mule
Drinks.tip: If you like this cocktail, its worth investing in your own Copper Mug, it not only keeps the drink colder it looks cool too!

Drinks.description: The Bloody Mary just celebrated it's 100th Birthday...100 years of being the go to cocktail for brunches, on airplanes and for hangovers!! A unique Savoury cocktail with a true multi-flavour mix of sweet, sour, salt, umami and spicy!
Drinks.name: Bloody Mary
Drinks.tip: A fantastic cocktail to personalise. Find your own twist or spice for that unique serve. Perhaps try a splash of port/sherry/red-wine into the mix for a bit of depth.

Drinks.description: Arguably the most popular cocktail World Wide! So simple, yet so refreshingly tasty. Ensure lots of ice and fresh fruit to compliment your gin your choice for a winning combination.
Drinks.name: Gin and Tonic
Drinks.tip: There are so many great Gins and premium tonics out there, find your perfect combo and get creative with the garnish!

Drinks.description: Sophisticated and simple at the same time with a complex flavor that makes the perfect aperitif. Popular all over the world and de rigeur during aperitivo hour in Milan
Drinks.name: Negroni
Drinks.tip: Serve with an orange peel twist.

Drinks.description: It may be Old by name, but this particular recipe and method is relatively modern and has become one of the most ordered cocktails in top bars Globally!
Drinks.name: Old Fashioned
Drinks.tip: An Old Fashioned can be made with pretty much any dark spirit. Choose your favourite to twist this classic.

Drinks.description: Coffee, almond, bourbon, and lemon, a new perfect match from your bar selection. Each distinct flavor combined to give you a smooth, sour, and great tasting new drink
Drinks.name: Whiscoffee Sourr
Drinks.tip: If you like more foam on your sour, try to dry shake before the hard shake with ice.

Drinks.description: The Mojito epitomises the long refreshing cocktail category, with its fresh minty flavours, Cuban roots and balanced flavours you can see why its popular from Havana to Tokyo.
Drinks.name: Mojito
Drinks.tip: Switch out the soda for a different mixer such as ginger ale or Champagne for a Mojito Royale!

Drinks.description: An absolute classic, stemming from the small mining town of Daiquiri in Cuba. The simple mix of the Rum, lime and sugar has sublime balance, hence its popularity Worldwide.
Drinks.name: Daiquiri
Drinks.tip: Try different styles of Rums (Aged/Spiced/Golden) for great variants on this amazing classic. Another twist is to add 3 raspberries in the shaker before shaking for a fruity and beautiful pink cocktail.

Drinks.description: A Mexican classic that’s hard to beat on a hot sunny day! Whether you like them served straight up, on the rocks, blended, with fresh fruit, or with a touch of salt, the combination is a true winner.
Drinks.name: Margarita
Drinks.tip: Good tequila is required. Salt is optional. Ice is totally your preference. A touch of fresh fruit or chili is a winner.

Drinks.description: Another cocktail that has survived from the disco era, long and colourful with the agave flavours of the tequila, the fresh citrus and the sweet syrup.
Drinks.name: Tequila Sunrise
Drinks.tip: Some like to layer the grenadine at the bottom whilst others drizzle from the top. Create your own 'sunrise' effect.

Drinks.description: A Classic cocktail stemming from the early 1900's with origins in Paris & London. Named apparently after the motorcycle sidecar of a guest. 3 ingredients, short & sharp with a smooth tang.
Drinks.name: Sidecar
Drinks.tip: Different lemons have a different acidity, tailor the ratio to your style and preference.

Drinks.description: A classic 'dessert' cocktail from the 1930's that brings together the unique flavours of the decadent brandy, rich chocolate and sweet cream.
Drinks.name: Brandy Alexander
Drinks.tip: Make sure you give this cocktail that extra hard shake to give that light foamy texture to tickle your tastebuds.

Drinks.description: The Amaretto Sour is a popular twist on the classic whisky sour. The nutty and marzipan flavours of the amaretto add an extra dimension to this great tasting and balanced cocktail.
Drinks.name: Amaretto Sour
Drinks.tip: The Sour is a very versatile cocktail for twisting. Works with pretty much every dark spirit. Why not experiment with different types of sugars or different bitters.

Drinks.description: A great looking shot that needs to be made by those with a steady hand. Creamy, coffee with a orange kick !
Drinks.name: B-52
Drinks.tip: Shots always taste better Cold! Get the bottles in the fridge if you can.

Drinks.description: Bloody red – fresh, and delicious! Rumbullion Rum with its hints of vanilla and orange takes this new and simple cocktail to the next level. Bitter and sour in perfect balance.
Drinks.name: RedRum

Drinks.description: Fresh and delicious, this vodka cocktail blended with the one and only Koskenkorva Vodka is perfect for a sunny day.
Drinks.name: Red River Punch

Drinks.description: Created by Jorg Meyer in 2008 in Germany, this cocktail has quickly become a smash WorldWide with the basil adding great herbaceous flavours to the libation.
Drinks.name: Gin Basil Smash
Drinks.tip: If you can get hold of Red basil instead of Green, it creates a fantastic twist to the cocktail

Spirits.description: Clean, neutral flavor, made from grains or potatoes.
Spirits.name: Vodka

Spirits.description: Flavored with juniper berries and botanicals.
Spirits.name: Gin

Spirits.description: Made from grains, aged in barrels (e.g., bourbon, rye, scotch).
Spirits.name: Whiskey

Spirits.description: Made from sugarcane or molasses, often sweet.
Spirits.name: Rum

Spirits.description: Made from blue agave, mostly in Mexico.
Spirits.name: Tequila

Spirits.description: Distilled from wine or fruit juice.
Spirits.name: Brandy

Spirits.description: Spirits with added sugar and flavors (e.g., Triple Sec, Amaretto).
Spirits.name: Liqueurs
